Setup To setup your development environment follow these steps:
Install subversion. It is recommended to install the native commandline client tool. If you are using Windows you might want to use tortoiseSVN instead or additionally. If you installed the commandline client, open a shell and type the following command to verify your installation:
svn --version
Check out the source-repository with your subversion client. With tortoiseSVN go to the folder where you want to checkout in your Windows-Exporer, perform a right-click and choose "Tortoise SVN > checkout". With the commandline client go to the directory where you want to checkout and type:
svn co http://m-m-m.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/m-m-m/trunk/ mmm
Install the Java JDK version 6 (1.6). Open a shell and type the following command to verify your installation:
java -version
Install maven. Open a shell and type the following command to verify your installation:
mvn -version
Install eclipse (choose "Eclipse IDE for Java Developers") on your system. You can use an IDE of your choice instead but eclipse is the only IDE supported in this manual.
You will also need a subversion-plugin for your IDE. Please note that the plugin has to match the version of your native subversion client (see above). For eclipse there is subclipse and subversive. Suggested is to use this update site: http://subclipse.tigris.org/update_1.4.x
You will also need to configure eclipse.
Open a shell and go to the directory where you checked out the repository and call the following command:
setup
Follow the instructions of the script. It will call mvn eclipse:eclipse -DdownloadSources=true to generate the eclipse project configuration. When you import these projects into your eclipse workbench via "Import... > Existing Projects into Workspace" then select the toplevel directory of your checked out repository. This will allow to import all sub-projects (there are many) in one step.
